content:
Time management is a crucial skill to master, and there are many excellent books on the topic. Here are some highly recommended books on time management that can help you optimize your productivity:

1. **"Getting Things Done: The Art of Stress-Free Productivity" by David Allen**: A classic in the productivity space, this book provides a comprehensive system for managing tasks, projects, and goals.
2. **"The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change" by Stephen Covey**: While not exclusively focused on time management, Habit 3 ("Put First Things First") is all about prioritization and time management.
3. **"Essentialism: The Disciplined Pursuit of Less" by Greg McKeown**: This book teaches you how to prioritize what's truly important, eliminate non-essential tasks, and create a system for managing your time and energy.
4. **"Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World" by Cal Newport**: A must-read for anyone struggling with distractions, this book provides strategies for cultivating deep focus and maximizing productivity.
5. **"The Pomodoro Technique" by Francesco Cirillo**: Since you're already using the Pomodoro Technique, this book can help you dive deeper into the methodology and optimize your use of it.
6. **"Time Warrior: How to Defeat Procrastination, People-Pleasing, Self-Doubt, Over-Commitment, Broken Promises, and Fear" by Steve Chandler**: A more unconventional approach to time management, this book focuses on developing a warrior mindset to overcome common productivity obstacles.
7. **"The One Thing: The Surprisingly Simple Truth Behind Extraordinary Results" by Gary Keller and Jay Papasan**: This book teaches you how to identify and focus on the most important tasks that drive results, eliminating unnecessary busywork.
8. **"Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience" by Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi**: While not exclusively a time management book, Flow explores the concept of being fully engaged and focused, which is essential for productivity.
9. **"Indistractable: How to Control Your Attention and Choose Your Life" by Nir Eyal**: A more recent release, this book provides practical strategies for managing distractions and staying focused in a world full of notifications and temptations.
10. **"The Productivity Project: Accomplishing More by Managing Your Time, Attention, and Energy" by Chris Bailey**: A comprehensive guide to productivity, this book covers a wide range of topics, from prioritization to energy management.

These books offer a mix of theoretical foundations, practical strategies, and inspiring stories to help you develop effective time management skills. You may find that different books resonate with you at different times, so feel free to explore and find the ones that work best for you!
